intro: Cassine cunninghamii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to eastern Australia and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and dry forest habitats. Cassine cunninghamii plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for native pollinators.
